posts.author: DungeonMasterDave
posts.content:
I've been thinking about build lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about build that came up in our game last night.

I'm trying to create an optimized character focused on build. What race/class/feat combinations would you recommend?

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about build?

posts.author: ClericofChaos
posts.content:
We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use build to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

For my next character, I want to focus on build as a central feature. What subclasses or multiclass options would work best with this?

How do other DMs balance encounters that involve build? I find it either makes combats too easy or too difficult.

In my campaign, we had a situation with build that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.author: DruidicDreamer
posts.content:
My DM interprets build differently than the rules as written. How do you all handle this at your tables?

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that build functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

I think the 2024 changes to build make it much more balanced compared to before.

posts.author: NaturalTwenty
posts.content:
I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for build are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

When DMing, I like to use build as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

Our table uses a house rule for build where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.
